attract.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.
attract.shortEffect: Target falls in love if it has the opposite gender, and has a 50% chance to refuse attacking the user.
attract.flavorText: If the target is of the opposite gender to the user, it becomes infatuated with the user and will sometimes be unable to use its moves.

sleep-talk.name: sleep-talk
sleep-talk.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user’s other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it’s forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.
sleep-talk.shortEffect: Randomly uses one of the user’s other three moves.  Only works if the user is sleeping.
sleep-talk.flavorText: The user randomly uses one of the moves it knows. This move can only be used while the user is asleep.

heal-bell.name: heal-bell
heal-bell.effect: Removes major status effects and confusion from every Pokémon in the user’s party.
heal-bell.shortEffect: Cures the entire party of major status effects.
heal-bell.flavorText: The user makes a soothing bell chime to cure the status conditions of all its fellow party Pokémon and allies.

return.name: return
return.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.
return.shortEffect: Power increases with happiness, up to a maximum of 102.
return.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

present.name: present
present.effect:
Randomly uses one of the following effects.

Effect                                             | Chance
-------------------------------------------------- | -----:
Inflicts regular damage with 40 power  |    40%
Inflicts regular damage with 80 power  |    30%
Inflicts regular damage with 120 power |    10%
Heals the target for 1/4 its max HP    |    20%

On average, this move inflicts regular damage with 52 power and heals the target for 1/20 its max HP.
present.shortEffect: Randomly inflicts damage with power from 40 to 120 or heals the target for 1/4 its max HP.
present.flavorText: The user attacks by giving the target a gift with a hidden trap. The gift restores HP sometimes, however.

frustration.name: frustration
frustration.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.
frustration.shortEffect: Power increases as happiness decreases, up to a maximum of 102.
frustration.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

safeguard.name: safeguard
safeguard.effect:
Protects Pokémon on the user’s side of the field from major status effects and confusion for five turns.  Does not cancel existing ailments.  This effect remains even if the user leaves the field.

If yawn is used while this move is in effect, it will immediately fail.

defog used by an opponent will end this effect.

This effect does not prevent the confusion caused by outrage, petal dance, or thrash.
safeguard.shortEffect: Protects the user’s field from major status ailments and confusion for five turns.
safeguard.flavorText: The user creates a protective field that prevents status conditions for five turns.

pain-split.name: pain-split
pain-split.effect:
Changes the user’s and target’s remaining HP to the average of their current remaining HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect does not count as inflicting damage for other moves and effects that respond to damage taken.

This effect fails against a substitute.
pain-split.shortEffect: Sets the user’s and targets’s HP to the average of their current HP.
pain-split.flavorText: The user adds its HP to the target's HP, then equally splits the combined HP between the target and itself.

sacred-fire.name: sacred-fire
sacred-fire.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to burn the target.  Frozen Pokémon may use this move, in which case they will thaw.
sacred-fire.shortEffect: Has a 50% chance to burn the target.  Lets frozen Pokémon thaw themselves.
sacred-fire.flavorText: The target is razed with a mystical fire of great intensity. This may also leave the target with a burn.

magnitude.name: magnitude
magnitude.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is selected at random between 10 and 150, with an average of 71:

Magnitude | Power | Chance
--------: | ----: | -----:
        4 |    10 |     5%
        5 |    30 |    10%
        6 |    50 |    20%
        7 |    70 |    30%
        8 |    90 |    20%
        9 |   110 |    10%
       10 |   150 |     5%

This move has double power against Pokémon currently underground due to dig.
magnitude.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

dynamic-punch.name: dynamic-punch
dynamic-punch.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to confuse the target.
dynamic-punch.shortEffect: Has a 100% chance to confuse the target.
dynamic-punch.flavorText: The user attacks by punching the target with full concentrated power. This also confuses the target.

megahorn.name: megahorn
megahorn.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
megahorn.flavorText: Using its tough and impressive horn, the user rams into the target with no letup.

dragon-breath.name: dragon-breath
dragon-breath.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.
dragon-breath.shortEffect: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.
dragon-breath.flavorText: The user exhales a mighty gust that inflicts damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

baton-pass.name: baton-pass
baton-pass.effect:
User switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  Stat changes, confusion, and persistent move effects are passed along to the replacement Pokémon.

The following move effects are passed:

* aqua ring
* both the user’s and target’s effect of block, mean look, and spider web
* the curse effect of curse
* embargo
* focus energy or an activated lansat berry
* gastro acid
* ingrain
* being sapped by leech seed
* being targeted by lock on or mind reader
* magnet rise
* perish song’s counter
* power trick
* substitute; the doll’s HP is unchanged

The replacement Pokémon does not trigger effects that respond to Pokémon switching in.
baton-pass.shortEffect: Allows the trainer to switch out the user and pass effects along to its replacement.
baton-pass.flavorText: The user switches places with a party Pokémon in waiting and passes along any stat changes.

encore.name: encore
encore.effect:
The next 4–8 times (selected at random) the target attempts to move, it is forced to repeat its last used move.  If the selected move allows the trainer to select a target, an opponent will be selected at random each turn.  If the target is prevented from using the selected move by some other effect, struggle will be used instead.  This effect ends if the selected move runs out of PP.

If the target hasn’t used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, if it does not know the selected move, or if the selected move has 0 PP remaining, this move will fail.  If the target’s last used move was encore, mimic, mirror move, sketch, struggle, or transform, this move will fail.
encore.shortEffect: Forces the target to repeat its last used move every turn for 2 to 6 turns.
encore.flavorText: The user compels the target to keep using the move it encored for three turns.

pursuit.name: pursuit
pursuit.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target attempts to switch out this turn before the user acts, this move hits the target before it leaves and has double power.

This effect can still hit a Pokémon that switches out when it has a substitute up or when an ally has used follow me.
pursuit.shortEffect: Has double power against, and can hit, Pokémon attempting to switch out.
pursuit.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

rapid-spin.name: rapid-spin
rapid-spin.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Removes leech seed from the user, frees the user from bind, clamp, fire spin, magma storm, sand tomb, whirlpool, and wrap, and clears spikes, stealth rock, and toxic spikes from the user’s side of the field.  If this move misses or has no effect, its effect doesn’t activate.
rapid-spin.shortEffect: Frees the user from binding moves, removes Leech Seed, and blows away Spikes.
rapid-spin.flavorText: The user performs a spin attack that can also eliminate the effects of such moves as Bind, Wrap, and Leech Seed. This also boosts the user's Speed stat.

sweet-scent.name: sweet-scent
sweet-scent.effect: Lowers the target’s evasion by one stage.
sweet-scent.shortEffect: Lowers the target’s evasion by one stage.
sweet-scent.flavorText: The user releases a scent that harshly lowers opposing Pokémon's evasiveness.

iron-tail.name: iron-tail
iron-tail.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target’s Defense by one stage.
iron-tail.shortEffect: Has a 30% chance to lower the target’s Defense by one stage.
iron-tail.flavorText: The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.

metal-claw.name: metal-claw
metal-claw.effect: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise the user’s Attack one stage.
metal-claw.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to raise the user’s Attack by one stage.
metal-claw.flavorText: The target is raked with steel claws. This may also boost the user's Attack stat.

vital-throw.name: vital-throw
vital-throw.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
vital-throw.flavorText:
The user attacks last. In return, this throw move
never misses.

morning-sun.name: morning-sun
morning-sun.effect:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.
morning-sun.shortEffect: Heals the user by half its max HP.  Affected by weather.
morning-sun.flavorText: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.

synthesis.name: synthesis
synthesis.effect:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.
synthesis.shortEffect: Heals the user by half its max HP.  Affected by weather.
synthesis.flavorText: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.

moonlight.name: moonlight
moonlight.effect:
Heals the user for half its max HP.

During sunny day, the healing is increased to 2/3 max HP.

During hail, rain dance, or sandstorm, the healing is decreased to 1/4 max HP.
moonlight.shortEffect: Heals the user by half its max HP.  Affected by weather.
moonlight.flavorText: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.

hidden-power.name: hidden-power
hidden-power.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user’s IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.
hidden-power.shortEffect: Power and type depend upon user’s IVs.  Power can range from 30 to 70.
hidden-power.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

cross-chop.name: cross-chop
cross-chop.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User’s critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
cross-chop.shortEffect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
cross-chop.flavorText: The user delivers a double chop with its forearms crossed. This move has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit.

twister.name: twister
twister.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make each target flinch.

If the target is under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop, this move will hit with double power.
twister.shortEffect: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.
twister.flavorText: The user whips up a vicious tornado to tear at opposing Pokémon. This may also make them flinch.

rain-dance.name: rain-dance
rain-dance.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user’s max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.
rain-dance.shortEffect: Changes the weather to rain for five turns.
rain-dance.flavorText: The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five turns, powering up Water-type attacks. The rain also lowers the power of Fire-type attacks.

sunny-day.name: sunny-day
sunny-day.effect:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user’s max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf guard are not affected by major status effects.

Pokémon with flower gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.
sunny-day.shortEffect: Changes the weather to sunny for five turns.
sunny-day.flavorText: The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering up Fire-type attacks. The sunlight also lowers the power of Water-type attacks.

crunch.name: crunch
crunch.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target’s Defense by one stage.
crunch.shortEffect: Has a 20% chance to lower the target’s Defense by one stage.
crunch.flavorText: The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.

mirror-coat.name: mirror-coat
mirror-coat.effect:
Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a special move this turn.  Inflicts twice the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
mirror-coat.shortEffect: Inflicts twice the damage the user received from the last special hit it took.
mirror-coat.flavorText: A retaliatory attack that counters any special move, inflicting double the damage taken.

psych-up.name: psych-up
psych-up.effect:
Discards the user’s stat changes and copies the target’s.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
psych-up.shortEffect: Discards the user’s stat changes and copies the target’s.
psych-up.flavorText: The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat change made by the target.

extreme-speed.name: extreme-speed
extreme-speed.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
extreme-speed.flavorText: The user charges the target at blinding speed. This move always goes first.

ancient-power.name: ancient-power
ancient-power.effect: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user’s stats one stage.
ancient-power.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user’s stats by one stage.
ancient-power.flavorText: The user attacks with a prehistoric power. This may also boost all the user's stats at once.

shadow-ball.name: shadow-ball
shadow-ball.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target’s Special Defense by one stage.
shadow-ball.shortEffect: Has a 20% chance to lower the target’s Special Defense by one stage.
shadow-ball.flavorText: The user attacks by hurling a shadowy blob at the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

future-sight.name: future-sight
future-sight.effect:
Inflicts typeless regular damage at the end of the third turn, starting with this one.  This move cannot score a critical hit.  If the target switches out, its replacement will be hit instead.  Damage is calculated at the time this move is used; stat changes and switching out during the delay won’t change the damage inflicted.  No move with this effect can be used against the same target again until after the end of the third turn.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.

If the target is protected by protect or detect on the turn this move is used, this move will fail.  However, the damage on the third turn will break through protection.

The damage is applied at the end of the turn, so it ignores endure and focus sash.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
future-sight.shortEffect: Hits the target two turns later.
future-sight.flavorText: Two turns after this move is used, a hunk of psychic energy attacks the target.

rock-smash.name: rock-smash
rock-smash.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target’s Defense by one stage.
rock-smash.shortEffect: Has a 50% chance to lower the target’s Defense by one stage.
rock-smash.flavorText: The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.

whirlpool.name: whirlpool
whirlpool.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

If the target is in the first turn of dive, this move will hit with double power.
whirlpool.shortEffect: Prevents the target from leaving battle and inflicts 1/16 its max HP in damage for 2-5 turns.
whirlpool.flavorText: The user traps the target inside a violent, swirling whirlpool that inflicts damage for four to five turns.

beat-up.name: beat-up
beat-up.effect:
Inflicts typeless regular damage.  Every Pokémon in the user’s party, excepting those that have fainted or have a major status effect, attacks the target.  Calculated stats are ignored; the base stats for the target and assorted attackers are used instead.  The random factor in the damage formula is not used.  dark Pokémon still get STAB.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.
beat-up.shortEffect: Hits once for every conscious Pokémon the trainer has.
beat-up.flavorText: The user gets all party Pokémon to attack the target. The more party Pokémon, the greater the number of attacks.

fake-out.name: fake-out
fake-out.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Causes the target to flinch.  Can only be used on the user’s first turn after entering the field.
fake-out.shortEffect: Can only be used as the first move after the user enters battle.  Causes the target to flinch.
fake-out.flavorText: This attack hits first and makes the target flinch. It works only on the first turn each time the user enters battle.

uproar.name: uproar
uproar.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.
uproar.shortEffect: Forced to use this move for several turns.  Pokémon cannot fall asleep in that time.
uproar.flavorText: The user attacks in an uproar for three turns. During that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.

stockpile.name: stockpile
stockpile.effect:
Raises the user’s Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.  Stores energy for use with spit up and swallow.  Up to three levels of energy can be stored, and all are lost if the user leaves the field.  Energy is still stored even if the stat boosts cannot be applied.

If the user uses baton pass, the stat boosts are passed as normal, but the stored energy is not.
stockpile.shortEffect: Stores energy up to three times for use with Spit Up and Swallow.
stockpile.flavorText: The user stores power and boosts its Defense and Sp. Def stats. This move can be used up to three times.

spit-up.name: spit-up
spit-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is equal to 100 times the amount of energy stored by stockpile.  Ignores the random factor in the damage formula.  Stored energy is consumed, and the user’s Defense and Special Defense are reset to what they would be if stockpile had not been used.  If the user has no energy stored, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
spit-up.shortEffect: Power is 100 times the amount of energy Stockpiled.
spit-up.flavorText: The power stored using the move Stockpile is released at once in an attack. The more power is stored, the greater the move's power.

swallow.name: swallow
swallow.effect: Heals the user depending on the amount of energy stored by stockpile: 1/4 its max HP after one use, 1/2 its max HP after two uses, or fully after three uses.  Stored energy is consumed, and the user’s Defense and Special Defense are reset to what they would be if stockpile had not been used.  If the user has no energy stored, this move will fail.
swallow.shortEffect: Recovers 1/4 HP after one Stockpile, 1/2 HP after two Stockpiles, or full HP after three Stockpiles.
swallow.flavorText: The power stored using the move Stockpile is absorbed by the user to restore its own HP. The more power is stored, the more HP is restored.

heat-wave.name: heat-wave
heat-wave.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.
heat-wave.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.
heat-wave.flavorText: The user attacks by exhaling hot breath on opposing Pokémon. This may also leave them with a burn.

hail.name: hail
hail.effect:
Changes the weather to hail for five turns, during which non-ice Pokémon are damaged for 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.

If the user is holding icy rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

blizzard has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, blizzard has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user’s max HP.

Pokémon with snow cloak are exempt from this effect’s damage.
hail.shortEffect: Changes the weather to a hailstorm for five turns.
hail.flavorText:
The user summons a hailstorm lasting five turns.
It damages all Pokémon except Ice types.

torment.name: torment
torment.effect:
Prevents the target from attempting to use the same move twice in a row.  When the target leaves the field, this effect ends.

If the target is forced to attempt a repeated move due to choice band, choice scarf, choice specs, disable, encore, taunt, only having PP remaining for one move, or any other effect, the target will use struggle instead.  The target is then free to use the forced move next turn, as it didn’t use that move this turn.
torment.shortEffect: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.
torment.flavorText: The user torments and enrages the target, making it incapable of using the same move twice in a row.

flatter.name: flatter
flatter.effect: Raises the target’s Special Attack by one stage, then confuses it.
flatter.shortEffect: Raises the target’s Special Attack by one stage and confuses the target.
flatter.flavorText: Flattery is used to confuse the target. However, this also boosts the target's Sp. Atk stat.

will-o-wisp.name: will-o-wisp
will-o-wisp.flavorText: The user shoots a sinister flame at the target to inflict a burn.

memento.name: memento
memento.effect: Lowers the target’s Attack and Special Attack by two stages.  User faints.
memento.shortEffect: Lowers the target’s Attack and Special Attack by two stages.  User faints.
memento.flavorText: The user faints. In return, the target's Attack and Sp. Atk stats are harshly lowered.

facade.name: facade
facade.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.
facade.shortEffect: Power doubles if user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.
facade.flavorText: This move's power is doubled if the user is poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.

focus-punch.name: focus-punch
focus-punch.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the user takes damage this turn before hitting, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.
focus-punch.shortEffect: If the user takes damage before attacking, the attack is canceled.
focus-punch.flavorText: The user focuses its mind before launching a punch. This move fails if the user is hit before using the move.

smelling-salts.name: smelling-salts
smelling-salts.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is paralyzed, this move has double power, and the target is cured of its paralysis.
smelling-salts.shortEffect: If the target is paralyzed, inflicts double damage and cures the paralysis.
smelling-salts.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

follow-me.name: follow-me
follow-me.effect:
Until the end of this turn, any moves that opposing Pokémon target solely at the user’s ally will instead target the user.  If both Pokémon on the same side of the field use this move on the same turn, the Pokémon that uses it last will become the target.

This effect takes priority over lightning rod and storm drain.

If the user’s ally switches out, opposing Pokémon may still hit it with pursuit.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
follow-me.shortEffect: Redirects the target’s single-target effects to the user for this turn.
follow-me.flavorText: The user draws attention to itself, making all opposing Pokémon take aim only at the user.

nature-power.name: nature-power
nature-power.effect:
Uses another move chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain                   | Selected move
------------------------- | ------------------
Building                  | tri attack
Cave                      | rock slide
Deep water                | hydro pump
Desert                    | earthquake
Grass                     | seed bomb
Mountain                  | rock slide
Road                      | earthquake
Shallow water             | hydro pump
Snow                      | blizzard
Tall grass                | seed bomb
electric terrain | thunderbolt
grassy terrain   | energy ball
misty terrain    | moonblast

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Selected move
-------------- | ------------------
Courtyard      | tri attack
Crystal        | rock slide
Gateway        | hydro pump
Magma          | rock slide
Main Street    | tri attack
Neon           | tri attack
Stargazer      | rock slide
Sunny Park     | seed bomb
Sunset         | earthquake
Waterfall      | seed bomb

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
nature-power.shortEffect: Uses a move which depends upon the terrain.
nature-power.flavorText:
This attack makes use of nature’s power. Its
effects vary depending on the user’s environment.

charge.name: charge
charge.effect: Raises the user’s Special Defense by one stage.  If the user uses an electric move next turn, its power will be doubled.
charge.shortEffect: Raises the user’s Special Defense by one stage.  User’s Electric moves have doubled power next turn.
charge.flavorText: The user becomes charged, boosting the power of the next Electric-type move it uses. This also boosts the user's Sp. Def stat.

taunt.name: taunt
taunt.effect:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.
taunt.shortEffect: For the next few turns, the target can only use damaging moves.
taunt.flavorText: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use only attack moves for three turns.

helping-hand.name: helping-hand
helping-hand.effect:
Boosts the power of the target’s moves by 50% until the end of this turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
helping-hand.shortEffect: Ally’s next move inflicts half more damage.
helping-hand.flavorText: The user assists an ally by boosting the power of that ally's attack.

trick.name: trick
trick.effect:
User and target permanently swap held items.  Works even if one of the Pokémon isn’t holding anything.  If either Pokémon is holding mail, this move will fail.

If either Pokémon has multitype or sticky hold, this move will fail.

If this move results in a Pokémon obtaining choice band, choice scarf, or choice specs, and that Pokémon was the latter of the pair to move this turn, then the move it used this turn becomes its chosen forced move.  This applies even if both Pokémon had a choice item before this move was used.  If the first of the two Pokémon gains a choice item, it may select whatever choice move it wishes next turn.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
trick.flavorText: The user catches the target off guard and swaps the target's held item with its own.

role-play.name: role-play
role-play.effect:
User’s ability is replaced with the target’s until the user leaves the field.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If the target has flower gift, forecast, illusion, imposter, multitype, stance change, trace, wonder guard, or zen mode, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
role-play.flavorText: The user mimics the target completely, copying the target's Ability.

wish.name: wish
wish.effect: At the end of the next turn, user will be healed for half its max HP.  If the user is switched out, its replacement will be healed instead for half of the user’s max HP.  If the user faints or is forcefully switched by roar or whirlwind, this effect will not activate.
wish.shortEffect: User will recover half its max HP at the end of the next turn.
wish.flavorText: One turn after this move is used, the user's or its replacement's HP is restored by up to half the user's max HP.

assist.name: assist
assist.effect:
Uses a move from another Pokémon in the user’s party, both selected at random.  Moves from fainted Pokémon can be used.  If there are no eligible Pokémon or moves, this move will fail.

This move will not select assist, chatter, circle throw, copycat, counter, covet, destiny bond, detect, dig, dive, dragon tail, endure, feint, fly focus punch, follow me, helping hand, me first, metronome, mimic, mirror coat, mirror move, phantom force protect, quick guard, roar shadow force, sketch, sleep talk, snatch, struggle, switcheroo, thief, trick, whirlwind, or wide guard.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by metronome or sleep talk.
assist.shortEffect: Randomly selects and uses one of the trainer’s other Pokémon’s moves.
assist.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

ingrain.name: ingrain
ingrain.effect:
Prevents the user from switching out.  User regains 1/16 of its max HP at the end of every turn.  If the user was immune to ground attacks, it will now take normal damage from them.

roar and whirlwind will not affect the user.  The user cannot use magnet rise.

The user may still use u turn to leave the field.

This effect can be passed with baton pass.
ingrain.shortEffect: Prevents the user from leaving battle.  User regains 1/16 of its max HP every turn.
ingrain.flavorText: The user lays roots that restore its own HP every turn. Because the user is now rooted, it can't switch out.

superpower.name: superpower
superpower.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user’s Attack and Defense by one stage each.
superpower.shortEffect: Lowers the user’s Attack and Defense by one stage after inflicting damage.
superpower.flavorText: The user attacks the target with great power. This also lowers the user's Attack and Defense stats.

magic-coat.name: magic-coat
magic-coat.effect:
The first non-damaging move targeting the user this turn that inflicts major status effects, stat changes, or trapping effects will be reflected at its user.

defog, memento, and teeter dance are not reflected.

attract, flatter, gastro acid, leech seed, swagger, worry seed, and yawn are reflected.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
magic-coat.shortEffect: Reflects back the first effect move used on the user this turn.
magic-coat.flavorText:
Moves like Leech Seed and moves that inflict status
conditions are blocked by a barrier and reflected back
to the user of those moves.

recycle.name: recycle
recycle.effect:
User recovers the last item consumed by the user or a Pokémon in its position on the field.  The item must be used again before it can be recovered by this move again.  If the user is holding an item, this move fails.

Items taken or given away by covet, knock off, switcheroo, thief, or trick may not be recovered.
recycle.shortEffect: User recovers the item it last used up.
recycle.flavorText: The user recycles a held item that has been used in battle so it can be used again.

revenge.name: revenge
revenge.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target damaged the user this turn and was the last to do so, this move has double power.

pain split does not count as damaging the user.
revenge.shortEffect: Inflicts double damage if the user takes damage before attacking this turn.
revenge.flavorText:
This attack move’s power is doubled if the user has
been hurt by the opponent in the same turn.

brick-break.name: brick-break
brick-break.effect: Destroys any light screen or reflect on the target’s side of the field, then inflicts regular damage.
brick-break.flavorText: The user attacks with a swift chop. This move can also break barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.

yawn.name: yawn
yawn.effect:
Puts the target to sleep at the end of the next turn.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  If the target leaves the field, this effect is canceled.  If the target has a status effect when this move is used, this move will fail.

If the target is protected by safeguard when this move is used, this move will fail.

insomnia and vital spirit prevent the sleep if the target has either at the end of the next turn, but will not cause this move to fail on use.
yawn.shortEffect: Target sleeps at the end of the next turn.
yawn.flavorText: The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target into falling asleep on the next turn.

knock-off.name: knock-off
knock-off.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

If the target has multitype or sticky hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.
knock-off.flavorText: The user slaps down the target's held item, making it unusable for that battle. This move does more damage if the target has a held item.

endeavor.name: endeavor
endeavor.effect: Inflicts exactly enough damage to lower the target’s HP to equal the user’s.  If the target’s HP is not higher than the user’s, this move has no effect.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.  This effect counts as damage for moves that respond to damage.
endeavor.shortEffect: Lowers the target’s HP to equal the user’s.
endeavor.flavorText: The user inflicts damage by cutting down the target's HP to roughly equal the user's HP.

eruption.name: eruption
eruption.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the user’s remaining HP and is given by `150 * HP / max HP`, to a maximum of 150 when the user has full HP.
eruption.shortEffect: Inflicts more damage when the user has more HP remaining, with a maximum of 150 power.
eruption.flavorText: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with explosive fury. The lower the user's HP, the lower the move's power.

skill-swap.name: skill-swap
skill-swap.effect:
User and target switch abilities.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If either Pokémon has multitype or wonder guard, this move will fail.
skill-swap.flavorText: The user employs its psychic power to exchange Abilities with the target.

imprison.name: imprison
imprison.effect: Prevents any Pokémon on the opposing side of the field from using any move the user knows until the user leaves the field.  This effect is live; if the user obtains new moves while on the field, these moves become restricted.  If no opposing Pokémon knows any of the user’s moves when this move is used, this move will fail.
imprison.shortEffect: Prevents the target from using any moves that the user also knows.
imprison.flavorText: If opposing Pokémon know any move also known by the user, they are prevented from using it.

refresh.name: refresh
refresh.effect: Removes a burn, paralysis, or poison from the user.
refresh.shortEffect: Cleanses the user of a burn, paralysis, or poison.
refresh.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

grudge.name: grudge
grudge.effect: If the user faints before it next acts, the move that fainted it will have its PP dropped to 0.  End-of-turn damage does not trigger this effect.
grudge.shortEffect: If the user faints this turn, the PP of the move that fainted it drops to 0.
grudge.flavorText:
If the user faints, the user’s grudge fully depletes
the PP of the opponent’s move that knocked it out.

snatch.name: snatch
snatch.effect:
The next time a Pokémon uses a beneficial move on itself or itself and its ally this turn, the user of this move will steal the move and use it itself.  Moves which may be stolen by this move are identified by the "snatchable" flag.

If two Pokémon use this move on the same turn, the faster Pokémon will steal the first beneficial move, and the slower Pokémon will then steal it again—thus, only the slowest Pokémon using this move ultimately gains a stolen move’s effect.

If the user steals psych up, it will target the Pokémon that used psych up.  If the user was the original target of psych up, and the Pokémon that originally used it’s affected by pressure, it will only lose 1 PP.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
snatch.shortEffect: Steals the target’s move, if it’s self-targeted.
snatch.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

secret-power.name: secret-power
secret-power.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyzes target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target’s Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target’s accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target’s accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target’s Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyzes target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target’s Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyzes target
Neon           | Paralyzes target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target’s accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep
secret-power.shortEffect: Has a 30% chance to inflict a status effect which depends upon the terrain.
secret-power.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

dive.name: dive
dive.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User dives underwater for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, surf, and whirlpool still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.
dive.shortEffect: User dives underwater, dodging all attacks, and hits next turn.
dive.flavorText: The user dives on the first turn, then floats up and attacks on the next turn.

arm-thrust.name: arm-thrust
arm-thrust.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
arm-thrust.flavorText: The user attacks the target with open-palmed arm thrusts. This move hits two to five times in a row.

camouflage.name: camouflage
camouflage.effect:
User’s type changes according to the terrain.

Terrain        | New type
-------------- | --------------
Building       | normal
Cave           | rock
Desert         | ground
Grass          | grass
Mountain       | rock
Ocean          | water
Pond           | water
Road           | ground
Snow           | ice
Tall grass     | grass

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | New type
-------------- | --------------
Courtyard      | normal
Crystal        | rock
Gateway        | water
Magma          | rock
Main Street    | normal
Neon           | normal
Stargazer      | rock
Sunny Park     | grass
Sunset         | ground
Waterfall      | grass
camouflage.shortEffect: User’s type changes to match the terrain.
camouflage.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

tail-glow.name: tail-glow
tail-glow.effect: Raises the user’s Special Attack by three stages.
tail-glow.shortEffect: Raises the user’s Special Attack by three stages.
tail-glow.flavorText: This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.

luster-purge.name: luster-purge
luster-purge.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target’s Special Defense by one stage.
luster-purge.shortEffect: Has a 50% chance to lower the target’s Special Defense by one stage.
luster-purge.flavorText: The user lets loose a damaging burst of light. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

mist-ball.name: mist-ball
mist-ball.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target’s Special Attack by one stage.
mist-ball.shortEffect: Has a 50% chance to lower the target’s Special Attack by one stage.
mist-ball.flavorText: A mist-like flurry of down envelops and damages the target. This may also lower the target's Sp. Atk stat.

feather-dance.name: feather-dance
feather-dance.effect: Lowers the target’s Attack by two stages.
feather-dance.shortEffect: Lowers the target’s Attack by two stages.
feather-dance.flavorText: The user covers the target's body with a mass of down that harshly lowers its Attack stat.

teeter-dance.name: teeter-dance
teeter-dance.flavorText: The user performs a wobbly dance that confuses every Pokémon around it.

blaze-kick.name: blaze-kick
blaze-kick.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User’s critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move. Has a 10% chance to burn the target.
blaze-kick.shortEffect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit and a 10% chance to burn the target.
blaze-kick.flavorText: The user launches a kick that has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit. This may also leave the target with a burn.

mud-sport.name: mud-sport
mud-sport.effect: electric moves inflict half damage, regardless of target.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.
mud-sport.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

ice-ball.name: ice-ball
ice-ball.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense curl since entering the field, this move has double power.
ice-ball.shortEffect: Power doubles every turn this move is used in succession after the first, resetting after five turns.
ice-ball.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

needle-arm.name: needle-arm
needle-arm.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
needle-arm.shortEffect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
needle-arm.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

slack-off.name: slack-off
slack-off.effect: Heals the user for half its max HP.
slack-off.shortEffect: Heals the user by half its max HP.
slack-off.flavorText: The user slacks off, restoring its own HP by up to half its max HP.

hyper-voice.name: hyper-voice
hyper-voice.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
hyper-voice.flavorText: The user attacks by letting loose a horribly loud, resounding cry.

poison-fang.name: poison-fang
poison-fang.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to badly poison the target.
poison-fang.shortEffect: Has a 50% chance to badly poison the target.
poison-fang.flavorText: The user bites the target with toxic fangs. This may also leave the target badly poisoned.

crush-claw.name: crush-claw
crush-claw.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target’s Defense by one stage.
crush-claw.shortEffect: Has a 50% chance to lower the target’s Defense by one stage.
crush-claw.flavorText: The user slashes the target with hard and sharp claws. This may also lower the target's Defense stat.

blast-burn.name: blast-burn
blast-burn.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
blast-burn.shortEffect: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.
blast-burn.flavorText: The target is razed by a fiery explosion. The user can't move on the next turn.

hydro-cannon.name: hydro-cannon
hydro-cannon.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
hydro-cannon.shortEffect: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.
hydro-cannon.flavorText: The target is hit with a watery blast. The user can't move on the next turn.

meteor-mash.name: meteor-mash
meteor-mash.effect: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 20% chance to raise the user’s Attack one stage.
meteor-mash.shortEffect: Has a 20% chance to raise the user’s Attack by one stage.
meteor-mash.flavorText: The target is hit with a hard punch fired like a meteor. This may also boost the user’s Attack stat.

astonish.name: astonish
astonish.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
astonish.shortEffect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.
astonish.flavorText: The user attacks the target by crying out in a startling fashion. This may also make the target flinch.

weather-ball.name: weather-ball
weather-ball.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If a weather move is active, this move has double power, and its type becomes the type of the weather move.  shadow sky is typeless for the purposes of this move.
weather-ball.shortEffect: If there be weather, this move has doubled power and the weather’s type.
weather-ball.flavorText: This move's type and power change depending on the weather at the time the move is used.

aromatherapy.name: aromatherapy
aromatherapy.effect: Removes major status effects and confusion from every Pokémon in the user’s party.
aromatherapy.shortEffect: Cures the entire party of major status effects.
aromatherapy.flavorText: This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.

fake-tears.name: fake-tears
fake-tears.effect: Lowers the target’s Special Defense by two stages.
fake-tears.shortEffect: Lowers the target’s Special Defense by two stages.
fake-tears.flavorText: The user feigns crying to fluster the target. This harshly lowers the target's Sp. Def stat.

air-cutter.name: air-cutter
air-cutter.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User’s critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
air-cutter.shortEffect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
air-cutter.flavorText: The user launches razor-like wind to slash opposing Pokémon. This move has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit.

overheat.name: overheat
overheat.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user’s Special Attack by two stages.
overheat.shortEffect: Lowers the user’s Special Attack by two stages after inflicting damage.
overheat.flavorText: The user attacks the target with all its might. The recoil from this move harshly lowers the user's Sp. Atk stat.

odor-sleuth.name: odor-sleuth
odor-sleuth.effect: Resets the target’s evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A ghost under this effect takes normal damage from normal and fighting moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
odor-sleuth.shortEffect: Forces the target to have no Evade, and allows it to be hit by Normal and Fighting moves even if it’s a Ghost.
odor-sleuth.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

rock-tomb.name: rock-tomb
rock-tomb.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target’s Speed by one stage.
rock-tomb.shortEffect: Has a 100% chance to lower the target’s Speed by one stage.
rock-tomb.flavorText: The user hurls boulders at the target to inflict damage. This also lowers the target's Speed stat by cutting off its movement.

silver-wind.name: silver-wind
silver-wind.effect: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user’s stats one stage.
silver-wind.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user’s stats by one stage.
silver-wind.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

metal-sound.name: metal-sound
metal-sound.effect: Lowers the target’s Special Defense by two stages.
metal-sound.shortEffect: Lowers the target’s Special Defense by two stages.
metal-sound.flavorText: A horrible sound like scraping metal harshly lowers the target's Sp. Def stat.

grass-whistle.name: grass-whistle
grass-whistle.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

tickle.name: tickle
tickle.effect: Lowers the target’s Attack and Defense by one stage.
tickle.shortEffect: Lowers the target’s Attack and Defense by one stage.
tickle.flavorText: The user tickles the target into laughing, lowering its Attack and Defense stats.

cosmic-power.name: cosmic-power
cosmic-power.effect: Raises the user’s Defense and Special Defense by one stage.
cosmic-power.shortEffect: Raises the user’s Defense and Special Defense by one stage.
cosmic-power.flavorText: The user absorbs a mystical power from space to boost its Defense and Sp. Def stats.

water-spout.name: water-spout
water-spout.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the user’s remaining HP and is given by `150 * HP / max HP`, to a maximum of 150 when the user has full HP.
water-spout.shortEffect: Inflicts more damage when the user has more HP remaining, with a maximum of 150 power.
water-spout.flavorText: The user spouts water to damage opposing Pokémon. The lower the user's HP, the lower the move's power.

signal-beam.name: signal-beam
signal-beam.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.
signal-beam.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.
signal-beam.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

shadow-punch.name: shadow-punch
shadow-punch.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
shadow-punch.flavorText: The user throws a punch from the shadows. This attack never misses.

extrasensory.name: extrasensory
extrasensory.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.
extrasensory.shortEffect: Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.
extrasensory.flavorText: The user attacks with an odd, unseeable power. This may also make the target flinch.

sky-uppercut.name: sky-uppercut
sky-uppercut.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop.
sky-uppercut.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage and can hit Bounce and Fly users.
sky-uppercut.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

sand-tomb.name: sand-tomb
sand-tomb.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid spin cancels this effect.
sand-tomb.shortEffect: Prevents the target from fleeing and inflicts damage for 2-5 turns.
sand-tomb.flavorText: The user traps the target inside a harshly raging sandstorm that inflicts damage for four to five turns.

sheer-cold.name: sheer-cold
sheer-cold.effect:
Inflicts damage equal to the target’s max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move’s accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock on, mind reader, and no guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.
sheer-cold.flavorText: The target faints instantly. This move is less likely to hit the target if used by Pokémon other than Ice types.

muddy-water.name: muddy-water
muddy-water.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target’s accuracy by one stage.
muddy-water.shortEffect: Has a 30% chance to lower the target’s accuracy by one stage.
muddy-water.flavorText: The user attacks by shooting muddy water at opposing Pokémon. This may also lower their accuracy.

bullet-seed.name: bullet-seed
bullet-seed.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
bullet-seed.flavorText: The user attacks by forcefully shooting seeds at the target. This move hits two to five times in a row.

aerial-ace.name: aerial-ace
aerial-ace.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
aerial-ace.flavorText: The user confounds the target with speed, then slashes. This attack never misses.

icicle-spear.name: icicle-spear
icicle-spear.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
icicle-spear.flavorText: The user attacks by launching sharp icicles at the target. This move hits two to five times in a row.

iron-defense.name: iron-defense
iron-defense.effect: Raises the user’s Defense by two stages.
iron-defense.shortEffect: Raises the user’s Defense by two stages.
iron-defense.flavorText: The user hardens its body's surface like iron, sharply boosting its Defense stat.

block.name: block
block.effect:
The target cannot switch out normally.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect ends when the user leaves the field.

The target may still escape by using baton pass, u turn, or a shed shell.

Both the user and the target pass on this effect with baton pass.
block.shortEffect: Prevents the target from leaving battle.
block.flavorText: The user blocks the target's way with arms spread wide to prevent the target from fleeing.

howl.name: howl
howl.effect: Raises the user’s Attack by one stage.
howl.shortEffect: Raises the user’s Attack by one stage.
howl.flavorText: The user howls loudly to rouse itself and its allies. This boosts their Attack stats.

dragon-claw.name: dragon-claw
dragon-claw.shortEffect: Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.
dragon-claw.flavorText: The user slashes the target with huge, sharp claws to inflict damage.

frenzy-plant.name: frenzy-plant
frenzy-plant.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.
frenzy-plant.shortEffect: User foregoes its next turn to recharge.
frenzy-plant.flavorText: The user slams the target with the roots of an enormous tree. The user can't move on the next turn.

bulk-up.name: bulk-up
bulk-up.effect: Raises the user’s Attack and Defense by one stage each.
bulk-up.shortEffect: Raises the user’s Attack and Defense by one stage.
bulk-up.flavorText: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body, boosting its Attack and Defense stats.

bounce.name: bounce
bounce.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User bounces high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky uppercut, smack down, thunder, and twister still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.
bounce.shortEffect: User bounces high into the air, dodging all attacks, and hits next turn.
bounce.flavorText: The user bounces up high on the first turn, then drops onto the target on the next turn. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

mud-shot.name: mud-shot
mud-shot.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target’s Speed by one stage.
mud-shot.shortEffect: Has a 100% chance to lower the target’s Speed by one stage.
mud-shot.flavorText: The user attacks by hurling a blob of mud at the target. This also lowers the target's Speed stat.

poison-tail.name: poison-tail
poison-tail.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User’s critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move. Has a 10% chance to poison the target.
poison-tail.shortEffect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit and a 10% chance to poison the target.
poison-tail.flavorText: The user hits the target with its tail. This move has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit and may also poison the target.

covet.name: covet
covet.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
covet.flavorText: The user endearingly approaches the target, then steals the target's held item.

volt-tackle.name: volt-tackle
volt-tackle.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
volt-tackle.shortEffect: User takes 1/3 the damage inflicted in recoil.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
volt-tackle.flavorText:
The user electrifies itself and charges the target.
This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack
may leave the target with paralysis.

magical-leaf.name: magical-leaf
magical-leaf.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
magical-leaf.flavorText: The user scatters curious leaves that chase the target. This attack never misses.

water-sport.name: water-sport
water-sport.effect: fire moves inflict half damage, regardless of target.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.
water-sport.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

calm-mind.name: calm-mind
calm-mind.effect: Raises the user’s Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage each.
calm-mind.shortEffect: Raises the user’s Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage.
calm-mind.flavorText: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to boost its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.

leaf-blade.name: leaf-blade
leaf-blade.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User’s critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
leaf-blade.shortEffect: Has an increased chance for a critical hit.
leaf-blade.flavorText: The user handles a sharp leaf like a sword and cuts the target to inflict damage. This move has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit.

dragon-dance.name: dragon-dance
dragon-dance.effect: Raises the user’s Attack and Speed by one stage each.
dragon-dance.shortEffect: Raises the user’s Attack and Speed by one stage.
dragon-dance.flavorText: The user vigorously performs a mystic, powerful dance that boosts its Attack and Speed stats.

rock-blast.name: rock-blast
rock-blast.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.
rock-blast.flavorText: The user attacks by hurling hard rocks at the target. This move hits two to five times in a row.

shock-wave.name: shock-wave
shock-wave.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
shock-wave.flavorText: The user strikes the target with a quick jolt of electricity. This attack never misses.

water-pulse.name: water-pulse
water-pulse.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.
water-pulse.shortEffect: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.
water-pulse.flavorText: The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. This may also confuse the target.

doom-desire.name: doom-desire
doom-desire.effect:
Inflicts typeless regular damage at the end of the third turn, starting with this one.  This move cannot score a critical hit.  If the target switches out, its replacement will be hit instead.  Damage is calculated at the time this move is used; stat changes and switching out during the delay won’t change the damage inflicted.  No move with this effect can be used against the same target again until after the end of the third turn.

This effect breaks through wonder guard.

If the target is protected by protect or detect on the turn this move is used, this move will fail.  However, the damage on the third turn will break through protection.

The damage is applied at the end of the turn, so it ignores endure and focus sash.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
doom-desire.shortEffect: Hits the target two turns later.
doom-desire.flavorText: This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.

psycho-boost.name: psycho-boost
psycho-boost.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user’s Special Attack by two stages.
psycho-boost.shortEffect: Lowers the user’s Special Attack by two stages after inflicting damage.
psycho-boost.flavorText: The user attacks the target with all its might. The recoil from this move harshly lowers the user's Sp. Atk stat.

roost.name: roost
roost.effect: Heals the user for half its max HP.  If the user is flying, its flying type is ignored until the end of this turn.
roost.shortEffect: Heals the user by half its max HP.
roost.flavorText: The user lands and rests its body. This move restores the user's HP by up to half its max HP.

gravity.name: gravity
gravity.effect:
For five turns (including this one), all immunities to ground moves are disabled.  For the duration of this effect, the evasion of every Pokémon on the field is lowered by two stages.  Cancels the effects of bounce, fly, and sky drop.

Specifically, flying Pokémon and those with levitate or that have used magnet rise are no longer immune to ground attacks, arena trap, spikes, or toxic spikes.

bounce, fly, sky drop, high jump kick, jump kick, and splash cannot be used while this move is in effect.

*Bug*: If this move is used during a double or triple battle while Pokémon are under the effect of sky drop, Sky Drop’s effect is not correctly canceled on its target, and it remains high in the air indefinitely.  As Sky Drop prevents the target from acting, the only way to subsequently remove it from the field is to faint it.
gravity.shortEffect: Disables moves and immunities that involve flying or levitating for five turns.
gravity.flavorText: Enables Flying types or Pokémon with the Levitate Ability to be hit by Ground-type moves for five turns. Moves that involve flying can't be used.

miracle-eye.name: miracle-eye
miracle-eye.effect: Resets the target’s evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A dark Pokémon under this effect takes normal damage from psychic moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.
miracle-eye.shortEffect: Forces the target to have no evasion, and allows it to be hit by Psychic moves even if it’s Dark.
miracle-eye.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

wake-up-slap.name: wake-up-slap
wake-up-slap.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is sleeping, this move has double power, and the target wakes up.
wake-up-slap.shortEffect: If the target is asleep, has double power and wakes it up.
wake-up-slap.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

hammer-arm.name: hammer-arm
hammer-arm.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user’s Speed by one stage.
hammer-arm.shortEffect: Lowers user’s Speed by one stage.
hammer-arm.flavorText: The user swings its strong, heavy fist at the target to inflict damage. This also lowers the user's Speed stat.

gyro-ball.name: gyro-ball
gyro-ball.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target’s current Speed compared to the user, given by `1 + 25 * target Speed / user Speed`, capped at 150.
gyro-ball.shortEffect: Power raises when the user has lower Speed, up to a maximum of 150.
gyro-ball.flavorText: The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin. The slower the user is than the target, the greater the move's power.

healing-wish.name: healing-wish
healing-wish.effect: User faints.  Its replacement’s HP is fully restored, and any major status effect is removed.  If the replacement Pokémon is immediately fainted by a switch-in effect, the next replacement is healed by this move instead.
healing-wish.shortEffect: User faints.  Its replacement has its HP fully restored and any major status effect removed.
healing-wish.flavorText: The user faints. In return, the Pokémon taking its place will have its HP restored and status conditions cured.

brine.name: brine
brine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target has less than half its max HP remaining, this move has double power.
brine.shortEffect: Has double power against Pokémon that have less than half their max HP remaining.
brine.flavorText: This move's power is doubled if the target's HP is at half or less.

natural-gift.name: natural-gift
natural-gift.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user’s held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.
natural-gift.shortEffect: Power and type depend on the held berry.
natural-gift.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

feint.name: feint
feint.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Removes the effects of detect or protect from the target before hitting.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome.
feint.flavorText: This attack can hit a target using a move such as Protect or Detect. This also lifts the effects of those moves.

pluck.name: pluck
pluck.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca berry or rowap berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move’s damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.
pluck.shortEffect: If target has a berry, inflicts double damage and uses the berry.
pluck.flavorText: The user attacks by pecking the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.

tailwind.name: tailwind
tailwind.effect: For the next three turns, all Pokémon on the user’s side of the field have their original Speed doubled.  This effect remains if the user leaves the field.
tailwind.shortEffect: For three turns, friendly Pokémon have doubled Speed.
tailwind.flavorText: The user whips up a turbulent whirlwind that boosts the Speed stats of itself and its allies for four turns.

acupressure.name: acupressure
acupressure.effect:
Raises one of the target’s stats by two stages.  The raised stat is chosen at random from any stats that can be raised by two stages.  If no stat is eligible, this move will fail.

If the target has a substitute, this move will have no effect, even if the user is the target.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.
acupressure.shortEffect: Raises one of a friendly Pokémon’s stats at random by two stages.
acupressure.flavorText: The user applies pressure to stress points, sharply boosting one of its or its allies' stats.

metal-burst.name: metal-burst
metal-burst.effect: Targets the last opposing Pokémon to hit the user with a damaging move this turn.  Inflicts 1.5× the damage that move did to the user.  If there is no eligible target, this move will fail.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.
metal-burst.shortEffect: Strikes back at the last Pokémon to hit the user this turn with 1.5× the damage.
metal-burst.flavorText: The user retaliates with much greater force against the opponent that last inflicted damage on it.

u-turn.name: u-turn
u-turn.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user’s trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain’s effect will end.
u-turn.shortEffect: User must switch out after attacking.
u-turn.flavorText: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.

close-combat.name: close-combat
close-combat.effect: Inflicts regular damage, then lowers the user’s Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.
close-combat.shortEffect: Lowers the user’s Defense and Special Defense by one stage after inflicting damage.
close-combat.flavorText: The user fights the target up close, inflicting damage without guarding itself. This also lowers the user's Defense and Sp. Def stats.

payback.name: payback
payback.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.
payback.shortEffect: Power is doubled if the target has already moved this turn.
payback.flavorText: The user stores power, then attacks. This move's power is doubled if the user moves after the target.

assurance.name: assurance
assurance.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target takes damage this turn for any reason before this move is used, this move has double power.
assurance.shortEffect: Power is doubled if the target has already received damage this turn.
assurance.flavorText: This move's power is doubled if the target has already taken some damage in the same turn.

embargo.name: embargo
embargo.effect:
Target cannot use its held item for five turns.  If the target leaves the field, this effect ends.

If a Pokémon under this effect uses bug bite or pluck on a Pokémon holding a berry, the berry is destroyed but not used.  If a Pokémon under this effect uses fling, it will fail.

This effect is passed by baton pass.
embargo.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

fling.name: fling
fling.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user’s held item.  The item is consumed.  If the user is not holding an item, or its item has no set type and power, this move will fail.

This move ignores sticky hold.

If the user is under the effect of embargo, this move will fail.
fling.shortEffect: Throws held item at the target; power depends on the item.
fling.flavorText: The user flings its held item at the target to attack. This move's power and effects depend on the item.

psycho-shift.name: psycho-shift
psycho-shift.effect: If the user has a major status effect and the target does not, the user’s status is transferred to the target.
psycho-shift.shortEffect: Transfers the user’s major status effect to the target.
psycho-shift.flavorText:
Using its psychic power of suggestion, the user
transfers its status conditions to the target.

trump-card.name: trump-card
trump-card.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is determined by the PP remaining for this move, after its PP cost is deducted.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

PP remaining | Power
------------ | ----:
4 or more    |    40
3            |    50
2            |    60
1            |    80
0            |   200

If this move is activated by another move, the activating move’s PP is used to calculate power.
trump-card.shortEffect: Power increases when this move has less PP, up to a maximum of 200.
trump-card.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

heal-block.name: heal-block
heal-block.effect: For the next five turns, the target may not use any moves that only restore HP, and move effects that heal the target are disabled.  Moves that steal HP may still be used, but will only inflict damage and not heal the target.
heal-block.shortEffect: Prevents target from restoring its HP for five turns.
heal-block.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

wring-out.name: wring-out
wring-out.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power directly relates to the target’s relative remaining HP, given by `1 + 120 * current HP / max HP`, to a maximum of 121.
wring-out.shortEffect: Power increases against targets with more HP remaining, up to a maximum of 121 power.
wring-out.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

power-trick.name: power-trick
power-trick.effect:
The user’s original Attack and Defense are swapped.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.
power-trick.flavorText:
The user employs its psychic power to switch its
Attack stat with its Defense stat.

gastro-acid.name: gastro-acid
gastro-acid.effect:
The target’s ability is disabled as long as it remains on the field.

This effect is passed on by baton pass.
gastro-acid.shortEffect: Nullifies target’s ability until it leaves battle.
gastro-acid.flavorText: The user hurls up its stomach acids on the target. The fluid eliminates the effect of the target's Ability.

lucky-chant.name: lucky-chant
lucky-chant.effect: For five turns, opposing Pokémon cannot score critical hits.
lucky-chant.shortEffect: Prevents the target from scoring critical hits for five turns.
lucky-chant.flavorText:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.

me-first.name: me-first
me-first.effect:
If the target has selected a damaging move this turn, the user will copy that move and use it against the target, with a 50% increase in power.

If the target moves before the user, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.
me-first.shortEffect: Uses the target’s move against it before it attacks, with power increased by half.
me-first.flavorText:
